hypothesis_content.title: Liquidity Vacuum Bounce at Previous High-Volume Nodes
hypothesis_content.statement: When price revisits a prior high-volume price node (where volume was >200% of 20-day average) after 7+ days absence, and current volume is <60% of that node's volume, price will bounce/reject with >2% move as resting liquidity gets triggered.
hypothesis_content.rationale: High-volume nodes represent price levels where significant liquidity previously exchanged hands. When price returns to these levels in low-volume conditions, resting limit orders from previous participants create support/resistance. Market makers defend these levels to avoid triggering larger order flows.
entry_conditions: Price returns within 0.5% of a prior high-volume node (volume >200% 20-day avg)
Current volume <60% of that node's volume
7+ days since price was last at this level

exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price breaks through node by >1.5% with increasing volume

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Price slices through high-volume nodes without reaction (>1.5% continuation) in more than 35% of backtested cases.
